japanese: その話、話したくない。
english: I don't want to talk about it.

japanese: これがどういう意味か分かりません。
english: I don't know what this means.

japanese: 地図を持ってこなかったことを悔んでいる。
english: I could kick myself for not bringing a map.

japanese: 自分の犬に噛まれたことってある？
english: Have you ever been bitten by your dog?

japanese: 飼ってる犬に噛まれたことある？
english: Have you ever been bitten by your dog?

japanese: 彼女はいますか？
english: Do you have a girlfriend?

japanese: 彼女いる？
english: Do you have a girlfriend?

japanese: 車庫を掃除するのはあんまり楽しくなかった。
english: Cleaning the garage wasn't much fun.

japanese: ヒトは、バカになってしまう唯一の対象種です。
english: Man is the only animal subject to becoming an imbecile.

japanese: 思い残すことがないように頑張るぞ。
english: I'll do my best to have no regrets.

japanese: そんなに長い距離を歩いたなんて、彼は足が丈夫に違いない。
english: Since he was able to walk so far, he must have strong legs.

japanese: まだ100円札があった時代には、アメリカドルは360円の価値があった。
english: Back when there were still hundred yen bills, the American dollar was worth 360 yen.

japanese: 日曜日に働いたかわりに、きょう休みを取りました。
english: I took today off in exchange for working on Sunday.

japanese: にほんごでスピーチなどできません。
english: I can't do a speech in Japanese.

japanese: やれるもんなら、やってみろ。
english: If it's something you can do, do it.

japanese: 電車に乗り遅れた時は遅刻するんじゃないかと焦ったけど、なんとかぎりぎりセーフで間にあったよ！
english: I was worried that I was going to be late when I missed my train, but I managed to get there just in time!

japanese: 何食べてるの？
english: What are you eating?

japanese: これはありがたい。
english: This pleases me.

japanese: あなたは私の父です。
english: You are my father.

japanese: あれはレモンの木だ。
english: That's a lemon tree.

japanese: それは青い家。
english: That's a blue house.

japanese: その男性は女性です。
english: The man is a woman.

japanese: フランクはチーズを少し食べる。
english: Frank eats some cheese.

japanese: 私は韓国人です。
english: I'm Korean.

japanese: 韓国人です。
english: I'm Korean.

japanese: 中国が好きだ。
english: I like China.

japanese: 私は中国が好きです。
english: I like China.

japanese: アメリカ合衆国が大好きです。
english: He really likes the United States.

japanese: お茶は好きですか？
english: Do you like tea?

japanese: 私はこの本が好きではありません。
english: I don't like this book.

japanese: 社長が好きですか。
english: Do you like your boss?

japanese: 私は中国が大好きです。
english: I really like China.

japanese: あなたはこの本が好きですか。
english: Do you like this book?

japanese: 中華料理が好きですか？
english: Do you like Chinese food?

japanese: 私は茶が好きではありません。
english: I don't like tea.

japanese: 私は仕事仲間が大好きだ。
english: I really like my coworkers.

japanese: あなたは私の友人が好きですか。
english: Do you like my friend?

japanese: あなたは学校が好きですか。
english: Do you like school?

japanese: あなた達は学校が好きですか。
english: Do you like school?

japanese: 学校は好き？
english: Do you like school?

japanese: さっきの試合、最後に逆転されておまえが負けるんじゃないかと思ってハラハラしたぞ。
english: The near-comeback at the end of the game earlier put me on the edge of my seat thinking that you might lose.

japanese: それは木です。
english: That's a tree.

japanese: あれは木です。
english: That's a tree.

japanese: 私たちはここにいます。
english: We are here.

japanese: 今食事中。
english: I'm eating now.

japanese: 食べた。
english: I ate.

japanese: 食べる。
english: I will eat.

japanese: バナナおいしい。
english: Bananas are delicious.

japanese: これは僕がバナナを食べてるとこ。
english: This is me eating a banana.

japanese: 彼はラムヅです。
english: He is Ramudu.

japanese: これを読みなさい。
english: Read this.

japanese: これを読んで。
english: Read this.

japanese: 赤いバラは咲いた？
english: Has the red rose blossomed?

japanese: なんで電話してきたの？
english: Why did you call me?

japanese: マンゴーは幾つ欲しいの？
english: How many mangoes do you want?

japanese: お茶を持ってきて。
english: Bring tea.

japanese: 母さんいつもありがとう。
english: Mom, thanks for everything.

japanese: 先週はあなたを手伝えてよかったわ。
english: I'm glad I was able to help you last week.

japanese: その長い首は馬に似ている。
english: Its long neck resembles that of a horse.

japanese: 先生は椅子に座っている。
english: The teacher is sitting on a chair.

japanese: 彼女って、お綺麗な方ですよ。
english: She is a beautiful woman.

japanese: きれいな女性ですよ。
english: She is a beautiful woman.

japanese: ここは写真撮って大丈夫ですか？
english: Can I take photographs here?

japanese: ナツメグがいるんですけど。
english: I need some nutmeg.

japanese: 私たちは彼が無事に戻った知らせを聞いて喜んだ。
english: We were glad to hear that he got back safely.

japanese: あなたの顔におめでとうございます。
english: Congratulations on your face.

japanese: バーベキューするのはいいんだけどさ、煙が目にしみるのが嫌なんだ。
english: It's OK with me if we barbecue, but I don't like it when smoke gets in my eyes.

japanese: あまりタカシに近づかない方がいいぞ。明日仕事の面接があるとかで、すごくぴりぴりしてるんだ。
english: You should stay away from Takashi for now. He has a work interview tomorrow or something, and he's really tense.

japanese: マシュマロを串に刺して火にあぶって食べるやつ、名前は知らないんだけどすごくうまそうだったよ。今度うちでもやってみようよ。
english: You know, the ones where you skewer some marshmallows and roast them. I don't know what they're called but they're really good. Let's try roasting some at my place sometime, too.

japanese: 彼のアドバイスはあまり役に立たなかった。
english: His advice didn't help much.

japanese: 彼のアドバイスは全く役に立たなかった。
english: His advice didn't help at all.

japanese: 彼の助言は全く役に立たなかった。
english: His advice didn't help at all.

japanese: 彼の新作映画は残念な出来だ。
english: His new movie is disappointing.

japanese: 今彼の頭には彼女に会うことしかない。
english: The only thing he's thinking about is seeing her.

japanese: あなたなら、大丈夫！
english: You'll be fine!

japanese: ジョンはあなたに出会うまでは怠け者でした。
english: John was a lazy person until he met you.

japanese: すみません。父は家にいません。
english: I'm sorry, my dad is not at home.

japanese: 日本では、まだ時々そろばんを使ってる人を見かけるけど、以前ほどではない。
english: In Japan, we still sometimes see someone use an abacus, but not as often as we used to.

japanese: 全く、前の車はなんでこんなにとろとろ走ってるんだ？仕事に遅れちゃうじゃないか。
english: Why is the car in front driving so slowly? I'm going to be late for work.

japanese: 見たいものを見ます。
english: We see what we want to see.

japanese: 足がしびれちゃって、すぐに立てそうにないよ。
english: My leg's gone to sleep, so I don't think I can stand up right away.

japanese: 今、足がしびれてるから、私の足に絶対触らないでよ！
english: My leg's gone to sleep, so whatever you do, don't touch my leg now.

japanese: お願い、笑わせないで！昨日腹筋のやり過ぎでお腹が筋肉痛なの！
english: Please don't make me laugh. I did too many sit-ups yesterday and my stomach muscles hurt.

japanese: わたしは服を着られないたくさんの人と、誰にも着られないたくさんの服を見た。
english: I saw many people who had no clothes and I saw many clothes which had no people in them.

japanese: なんでお前がトムのこと嫌いなのか、分かってきたよ。
english: I'm beginning to understand why you don't like Tom.

japanese: トムはメアリーの詩がわかっているような振りをした。
english: Tom pretended to understand Mary's poem.

japanese: トムは、メアリーが彼にして欲しいことが何なのか、分からないふりをした。
english: Tom pretended he didn't understand what Mary wanted him to do.

japanese: リハーサルなしでのぶっつけ本番の演奏だったため、あまり上手い出来とは言えなかった。
english: Because I did the performance without any preparation whatsoever, I can't say it was good.

japanese: しらばっくれるな！君が万引きしたところを警備員が見ていたんだぞ。
english: Stop playing dumb! The security guards saw you shoplifting!

japanese: よくもそんな白々しい嘘がつけるな。
english: How dare you tell such a barefaced lie?

japanese: とぼけてないで、私の質問にちゃんと答えて！
english: Don't play dumb. Answer my question properly!

japanese: 私は放課後テニスをします。
english: I play tennis after school.

japanese: 君には全然関係ないでしょ！
english: That's none of your business!

japanese: いくら家の中だからって、すっぽんぽんで歩き回るのはやめてよ！
english: It doesn't matter how much you keep saying this is your house, please stop walking around naked.

japanese: 家の中で全裸で何が悪い！
english: What's wrong with being nude in your own house?

japanese: ラテン語はわかりません。
english: I don't know the Latin language.

japanese: 「本はあなたのものですか？」「そうじゃありません」
english: "Are the books yours?" "They aren't."

japanese: 魚は泳ぐことができます。
english: The fish can swim.

japanese: 「俺の文は全く訳されないかもしれない」という考えが浮かんだ。
english: It occurred to me that my sentences may never be translated.

japanese: 丘の日が当っている部分は落葉樹でいっぱいだ。
english: The sunny side of the hill is full of deciduous trees.

japanese: 飛び越えろ！
english: Jump!

japanese: 飛び降りろ！
english: Jump!

japanese: こちらに来たまえ。
english: Come over here.

japanese: 靴とコートと傘を持ってきています。
english: I have brought my shoes, coat and umbrella.

japanese: 前は持ってたんだけど、盗まれちゃったのよ。
english: I used to have one, but it was stolen.

japanese: バスはどこですか。
english: Where is the bus?

japanese: あの馬鹿、どこへ行くつもりだ？
english: Where does that idiot think he is going?

japanese: さっき携帯が鳴ってたよ。
english: Your cell phone rang a minute ago.

japanese: トムはメアリーに象の絵を描いてあげた。
english: Tom sketched a picture of an elephant for Mary.

japanese: トムさんは背の低い人は背の高い人より長く睡眠をとらなければならないとどこかの読み物で読みました。
english: Tom read somewhere that short people need more sleep than tall people.

japanese: 背の低い人は背の高い人より多くの睡眠が必要であると、トムはどこかで読んだ。
english: Tom read somewhere that short people need more sleep than tall people.

japanese: 今日はあっさりしたものが食べたい。
english: Today I want to eat something light.

japanese: 今日は軽いものが食べたいな。
english: Today I want to eat something light.

japanese: ２０分ごとにバスがある。
english: There is a bus every 20 minutes.

japanese: 日本の温泉に入湯が許されるよう、トムは小さな蜘蛛の刺青の上にバンドエイドを貼った。
english: Tom put a Band-Aid over his small tattoo of a spider so he would be allowed into a Japanese hot spring.

japanese: バッグを１つ購入しました。
english: I purchased one bag.

japanese: 他にけがをした者はいないか。
english: Was anybody else hurt?

japanese: 誰か他にけがをしてたの？
english: Was anybody else hurt?

japanese: 彼女は花が好きだと言います。
english: She says she likes flowers.

japanese: 朝ご飯は抜きでした。
english: I skipped breakfast.

japanese: 腕相撲しようか。
english: You wanna arm wrestle?

japanese: 腕相撲しない？
english: You wanna arm wrestle?

japanese: 自分の家を裸で練り歩いて何が悪い！
english: What's wrong with running around your house naked?

japanese: 何年も前、子どもたちが小さかったころ、トムはたくさんの写真を撮ったものだ。
english: Years ago, when Tom's children were young, he used to take a lot of pictures.

japanese: トムが辞めるって聞いた？
english: Did you hear about Tom's resignation?

japanese: 私の庭のバラは、美しい。
english: The roses in my garden are beautiful.

japanese: トムはいつも銃を持ち歩いているのですか。
english: Does Tom always carry a gun?

japanese: トムが真実を言っていないとは一度も考えた事はなかった。
english: It never occurred to me that Tom might not be telling the truth.

japanese: この写真、一週間前に撮ったんだ。
english: I took this picture a week ago.

japanese: ブリッグス氏はただの医者ではなく、優れた外科医だ。
english: Mr Briggs is not any doctor, he is an excellent surgeon.

japanese: 紅茶にお砂糖はいかがですか？
english: Would you like some sugar in your tea?

japanese: 砂糖はいらないよ。
english: I don't want any sugar.

japanese: モニカはあまり勉強しない。
english: Monica doesn't study a lot.

japanese: あれ？並べる順番があべこべだけど、いいの？
english: Huh? The order is reversed, is that alright?

japanese: トムは先日新しいレストランで食べました、しかし、彼はレストランの名前を覚えていません。
english: Tom ate at a new restaurant the other day, but he doesn't remember the restaurant's name.

japanese: 彼女はとてもあっさりした性格だ。
english: She has a very open personality.

japanese: 隣の家が何だかがやがやとうるさい。パーティーでもしているのだろうか？
english: The house next door is a bit loud. I wonder if they're throwing a party.

japanese: 転校生が来ると聞いてクラスはざわざわと色めき立った。
english: Hearing that a transfer student was coming, the class buzzed with excitement.

japanese: 電車に乗ったころはしとしとという感じであった雨が、今はざあざあと降っている。
english: The rain that was drizzling when I got on to the train is now pouring.

japanese: 起きているときはあれだけにぎやかだった子どもたちも、今はすやすやと静かな寝息を立てている。
english: The kids that had been so lively when they were awake are now silently sleeping soundly.

japanese: すやすやと眠る娘の顔を見ると、また明日もがんばろうと思う。
english: When I see the soundly sleeping face of my daughter, I think, "I will give it my all tomorrow, too."

japanese: せずに済むなら誰もこんなことはしない。
english: If it didn't need to be done, nobody would do this kind of thing.

japanese: 灰色をしたうさぎが姿を見せたので近寄ろうとすると、ぴょんぴょんとまた林の中へ駆けていった。
english: An ash-colored rabbit appeared and as soon as I drew near, it hopped and ran into the woods again.

japanese: 彼女は何でここにいるんだ。
english: Why is she here?

japanese: 病気をしてから夫は２０kgも体重が落ちて、ズボンなどはもうぶかぶかです。
english: Since my husband became sick he's lost 20 kilograms and his pants are now baggy.

japanese: 大聖堂は西の扉にロマネスク様式の名残があり、半円状のアーチを見ることができる。
english: There are traces of Romanesque style at the west gate of the cathedral, such as a semi-circular arch.

japanese: 妹の趣味はウェブ用のアイコンのデザインで、暇を見つけて作っては自分のサイトで無料で配布している。
english: My little sister's hobby is designing icons on the web, and she distributes them free of charge on her website whenever she finds the free time to do so.

japanese: 北京には自転車が９００万台ある。
english: There are nine million bicycles in Beijing.

japanese: 太郎のアシストのおかげで少しは彼女に好印象を与えられた気がする。
english: Thanks to Taro's help, I think I was able to make a bit of good impression on her.

japanese: カタール戦スタメンで出場した彼は１ゴール２アシストと最高の代表デビューをかざった。
english: He had a superb debut, appearing in the starting lineup against Qatar with one goal and two assists.

japanese: スープは熱すぎます。
english: The soup is too hot.

japanese: 黒猫は悪運を招きます。
english: Black cats are bad luck.

japanese: 猫は黒いんだ。
english: The cat is black.

japanese: ゆっくりと明瞭に話してください。
english: Please speak slowly and clearly.

japanese: ジョンはわたしの２歳年上だ。
english: John is two years older than me.

japanese: わたしの家には階段がふたつある。
english: There are two staircases in my house.

japanese: 「純粋理性批判」はドイツの哲学者エマニュエル・カントの主著である。
english: Critique of Pure Reason is German philosopher Immanuel Kant's chief literary work.

japanese: 今出かけている。
english: I'm on my way out.

japanese: この瞬間を待ち望んでいました。
english: I've been waiting for this moment.

japanese: 世界中からテグに集まったアスリートで最も注目されたのはやはりボルトだった。
english: Of all the world's athletes who had gathered in Daegu, surely Bolt was the one who attracted the most attention.

japanese: 林間学校から帰ってきた息子は、フィールドアスレチックがいかに楽しかったかを事細かに説明してくれた。
english: Just after he returned from outdoor school, my son explained to me in great detail how much he enjoyed field athletics.

japanese: 彼は関西のアダルト産業に強い影響力を持っている。
english: He's very influential in Kansai's adult industry.

japanese: エクスタシーはアッパー系のドラッグだ。
english: Ecstasy is a stimulant type of drug.

japanese: 僕の猫がぬれている。
english: My cat is wet.

japanese: アトピーのためかかった病院で、刺激の少ないというシャンプーを勧められた。確かに効果はあるようなのだが、これがとても高価で困っている。
english: The hospital that I went to for my allergies recommended me a shampoo that wouldn't trigger them. It's certainly effective - I think - but it's just way too expensive.

japanese: 計画では母のアトリエになるはずだったこの部屋だが、結局は物置になってしまっている。
english: The plan was for this room to become a studio for Mom, but it ended up becoming storage space.

japanese: アトリエにはおそらく描きかけであろう油絵が一枚。それ以外に一枚の絵も残されていなかった。
english: There was a single oil painting left unfinished in the studio. No other pictures were there.

japanese: やった！
english: We did it!

japanese: 絶交だ。
english: It's over.

japanese: なんてことをしてくれたんだ。
english: What have you done?

japanese: 撃て！
english: Open fire!

japanese: トムは常に、これこれをして欲しいと頼むより、それをしろと要求するタイプの人間だ。
english: Tom is the type of person who always demands that something be done rather than request that it be done.

japanese: トムは口論をふっかけるのを楽しんでいるようだ。
english: Tom seems to enjoy provoking arguments.

japanese: 先日小学校のクラス会に出席したが、みんなすっかり変わってしまっていた。
english: I went to my primary school reunion a few days ago, but it was almost impossible to recognise anyone.

japanese: なんて素晴らしい天気でしょう！
english: What a beautiful day!

japanese: このアニメ、子供時代によく見てたんだけど、最終回で主人公がどうなったかの記憶があやふやなんだ。
english: I used to watch this anime a lot when I was a kid, but I can't quite remember what happened to the hero in the final episode.

japanese: 彼は自分の席に座った。
english: Tom took his place at the table.

japanese: トムはテーブルについた。
english: Tom sat down at the table.

japanese: 何人死んだの？
english: How many died?

japanese: またあしたね。
english: See you tomorrow!

japanese: 何て言ったらいいのやら......。
english: I don't know what to say...

japanese: 私は馬鹿じゃないですよ。
english: I'm not stupid.

japanese: 馬鹿じゃあるまいし。
english: I'm not stupid.

japanese: 君が思うほど僕はばかじゃない。
english: I'm not as stupid as you think I am.

japanese: トムは一昨日から全く寝ていない。
english: Tom hasn't slept at all since the day before yesterday.

japanese: トムは学校に行くのが嫌いです。
english: Tom hates going to school.

japanese: ロジバンが話せる人に気をつけて！
english: Be careful of people who can speak Lojban!

japanese: トムは寒いのが嫌いなんだよ。
english: Tom hates it when it's cold.

japanese: トムは他人を操る癖のある者が気に食わない。
english: Tom doesn't like people who manipulate others.

japanese: タイタニックが沈んだ時にどれくらいの死者が出たかあなたは見当がつきますか？
english: Do you have any idea how many people died when the Titanic sunk?

japanese: フランス語は久しく話していない。
english: It's been a long time since I last spoke French.

japanese: 休みらしい休みは久しく取っていない。
english: It's been a long time since I've had a real vacation.

japanese: 彼はあなたのお父さんです。
english: He's your father.

japanese: 今日の田中君が休んだ理由は、おばあさんが亡くなったって？確か先月も先々月もそう言ってなかったか？ずる休みするにしても、もう少しましな理由はないのかね。
english: So the reason that Tanaka stayed home today was because his grandmother died? Didn't he say that last month, and the month before that, too? Skipping is one thing, but I'd like him to at least come up with a better excuse than that.

japanese: こちらこそ、私もお会いできてよかったです。
english: Likewise, it was nice to meet you.

japanese: 今日、私は鼻血が出た。
english: I had a nosebleed today.

japanese: どうしてフランス語を勉強してるの？
english: Why do you study French?

japanese: 結婚式はいつですか？
english: When's the wedding?

japanese: 彼女は果物を食べている。
english: She's eating fruit.

japanese: 僕はあまり疲れてない。
english: I am not too tired.

japanese: そうなんですか？
english: Is that so?

japanese: そうなの？
english: Is that so?

english: A bird is known by its song, and a man by his words.

japanese: 彼にそれを話さなければならない。

english: I like fruit.

english: I like Toki Pona.

english: Alice sleeps in her room.

english: I will wash my car.

english: The house is burning!

english: Trying is good.

english: Is this Latin?

english: Are you allergic to this medicine?

japanese: 僕は意気地なしだ。
english: I'm a coward.

english: I owe you one.

english: She's a tough one.

english: There is an ample market for this product.

japanese: 落ち着けよ！
english: Calm down!

english: I'm going to buy some currant juice.

english: All apples are red.

japanese: 彼女の悲しみは顔全体に表れていた。
english: Her sadness was written all over her face.

japanese: 自転車で行く方がいいな。
english: I prefer to go by bicycle.

japanese: 深い霧のせいで道路が見えにくかった。
english: Due to the thick fog, the road was difficult to see.

japanese: 褒められても謙虚さが大事。
english: Even when one is being praised, modesty is important.

japanese: 彼は裏表のない道化。苦悩していないただの道化でした。
english: He was a jester, and nothing more. He felt no pain; he was a jester, and nothing more.

japanese: なぜトムがメアリーと会いたくないのか分からない。
english: I'm not sure why Tom didn't want to meet Mary.

japanese: 私はどうしてトムさんがあんなことを言ってしまったのかわかりませんが、今は悔しがっているんでしょう。
english: I'm not sure why Tom said those things, but I bet he now wishes he hadn't.

japanese: 彼は日本人ですか？
english: Is he Japanese?

japanese: 彼女は日本人ですか。
english: Is she Japanese?

japanese: この湖には沢山の魚がいます。
english: There are a lot of fish in this lake.

japanese: アムステルダムは凄いんだよ。
english: Amsterdam is amazing!

japanese: アムステルダムって凄いね！
english: Amsterdam is amazing!

japanese: 私は母親に、4時に起こしてくれるよう頼んだ。
english: I asked my mother to wake me up at four.

japanese: 私の部屋にどうやって入ってきたの？
english: How did you enter my room?

japanese: どうやって僕の部屋に入ったんだ？
english: How did you enter my room?

japanese: この文の翻訳は悪い翻訳。
english: The translation of this sentence is a bad translation.

japanese: これは竪琴だ。
english: It's a harp.

japanese: 一緒に日本に帰ろう。
english: Let's return to Japan together.

japanese: 君の気持ちが分かるような気がする。
english: I feel like I understand your feelings.

english: It's Baba's voice.

japanese: 歌ってみようか？
english: Should we sing?

japanese: ドロシーたちはエメラルドの都を目指して旅を続けた。
english: Dorothy and her friends continued their journey heading for Emerald city.

japanese: 俺の姉ちゃんはウルトラマンが好きだ。
english: My sister likes Ultraman.

japanese: 僕の妹はウルトラマンが好きだ。
english: My sister likes Ultraman.

japanese: 私がよく行く飲み屋はガード下にあるため、いつもガタンゴトンという電車の通過音を聞きながら飲んでいる。
english: My favorite bar is located below the railway, so I always hear the clanging noise of the trains passing by when I'm drinking.

japanese: 震災後このエリアの地価は大きく下がった。
english: After the earthquake, the land value in this area went down a lot.

japanese: 帰るわけには行かないのです。
english: I cannot come back in the current circumstances.

japanese: そのインコが死んでいる。
english: The parrot is dead.

japanese: 彼女は飾り気のない格好をしてはいる。しかし育ちから来るエレガンスは隠せないものだ。
english: She's wearing plain clothes. However, she cannot hide the elegance that comes from her upbringing.

japanese: 自分を信じて。
english: Believe in yourself.

japanese: 来てくれたら話すよ。
english: I will tell you when you visit.

japanese: 会いに来てくれたら教えてあげる。
english: I will tell you when you visit.

japanese: 私はモニターの文字を読む事が困難です。
english: I'm having trouble reading the letters on the monitor.

japanese: すごく暑いのは好きじゃない。
english: I don't like it when it's very hot.

japanese: 早い話、クビになっちゃった。
english: Long story short, I was fired.

japanese: 愛していると彼女に伝えたい。
english: I'd like to tell her that I love her.

japanese: おじいさまのことは、なんと申し上げてよいやら。
english: I'm sorry for your grandfather.

japanese: 「奥様のお名前は？」「結婚してない」
english: "What's your wife's name?" "I'm not married."

japanese: 海岸には大勢の人がいた。
english: There were a lot of people on the beach.

japanese: 「じゃね」と言いたい。
english: I want to say goodbye.

japanese: フランス語の文法を勉強してるとこだよ。
english: I'm studying French grammar.

japanese: それは私のです。あなたのはわかりません。
english: That is mine. I don't know where yours is.

japanese: 妹は車を持ってないよ。
english: My sister doesn't have a car.

japanese: スペイン語とポルトガル語はよく似た言語です。
english: Spanish and Portuguese are very similar languages.

japanese: 彼女はズボンなんて履かないわ。
english: She never wears pants.

japanese: 孫に会いに行くときは、必ず何かプレゼントしているんですよ。
english: When I go to see my grandson, I always give him something.

japanese: ポーカーのフルハウスって、何？
english: In poker, what's a full house?

japanese: ポーカーのフルハウスとは？
english: In poker, what's a full house?

japanese: 仔牛肉を食べますか。
english: Do you eat veal?

japanese: 鉱業はチリの主要な収入源の一つである。
english: Mining is one of the main sources of wealth in Chile.

japanese: トムは手話通訳者になりたかった。
english: Tom wanted to become a sign language interpreter.

japanese: トムは手話通訳士になりたかったんだ。
english: Tom wanted to become a sign language interpreter.

japanese: あそこに喫茶店があります。
english: There is a coffee shop over there.

japanese: 憲法裁判所は、今日の朝の内に判決を下すだろう。
english: The constitutional court will issue a decision by noon today.

japanese: 1959年9月26日に、日本観測史上最大の台風が名古屋を襲った。
english: On September 26, 1959, the strongest typhoon in Japan's recorded history hit Nagoya.

japanese: 彼女はぼんやりして頼りない者だ。
english: She is an absent-minded and unreliable person.

japanese: 窓の外から聞こえてきた雀のチュンチュンという鳴き声で、夜が明けたことを知った。
english: When I heard the sound of sparrows chirping outside the window, I realised dawn had come.

japanese: 今のバイト気に入ってはいるんだけどね、何か不具合があったときに大声で上司を呼ばなきゃならないのがちょっと。エレガントじゃないというかさ。
english: I like this job, but I'd prefer not to call my boss over in a loud voice whenever something bad happens. I'm partial to elegance.

japanese: 息子ですか？クラシックは興味ないみたいです。テクノだかエレクトリックだか知りませんが大きな音でいつも聴いてますね。
english: My son? He doesn't seem interested in classical music. I can't tell whether it's techno or electro, but he's always listening to music at a loud volume.

japanese: 隠してあったエロ漫画を彼氏に見つけられてしまった。
english: My boyfriend discovered the erotic comics book that I had been hiding.

japanese: エロチックな描写が倒錯的過ぎてこの人の本は俺には合わない。
english: This author's books don't suit me because the erotic descriptions are too perverted.

japanese: どうすればいいのか分からなくて、彼女を呼んでみた。
english: Not knowing what to do, I called her.

japanese: ハトにえさをやるのが好きです。
english: I like to feed the pigeons.

japanese: ちょっぴり退屈だ。
english: I'm just a little bored.

japanese: 彼女は肉を食べないよね？
english: She doesn't eat meat, does she?

japanese: 彼女って肉は食べないんでしょ？
english: She doesn't eat meat, does she?

japanese: やっぱりハイエンド機種だけあって設定項目とかすごい細かい。自分の物にするにはしばらく時間が掛かりそう。
english: As you'd expect from a high-end model, the user settings are amazingly detailed. It seems like it'll be a while until I can get one of my own.

japanese: さっき駅で聴いた曲が頭の中をエンドレスで回っている。
english: The song I heard before in the train station loops endlessly around my head.

japanese: この薬は男性にのみ効果があります。
english: The medicine only works on men.

japanese: この薬は男性にしか効きません。
english: The medicine only works on men.

japanese: このホールは５０００人収容できる。
english: This hall can hold 5,000 people.

japanese: ご自分のやりたいことをやってください。
english: Do what you want.

japanese: 彼が考えた生物は皆には浮かぶ反吐にしか見えなかった。
english: The creatures he thought of looked like flying vomit to everyone else.

japanese: 犯人に会うまで迷いが解けません。
english: You can not solve your doubts until you face the culprit.

japanese: 彼女は横柄に私に代わって返事した。
english: She arrogantly answered in my place.

japanese: オーディオを趣味とするには今の稼ぎではとても足りない。
english: It would be impossible to take an interest in audio with my current savings.

japanese: いつかオートクチュールに身を包むんだという彼女の夢が意外な形で実現した。
english: One day, her dream to be dressed in haute couture came true in an unexpected way.

japanese: あの、わたしオートマしか運転できないんですけど。
english: Er, I can only drive cars with an automatic transmission.

japanese: 私はフィンランド人なのに、スウェーデン語も話せる。
english: I am Finnish, but I speak also Swedish.

japanese: プレトリアスの人生についてはほんのわずかしか分かっていない。
english: I know next to nothing about the life of Praetorius.

japanese: この問題をどのように解決しましょうか？
english: How are we going to solve this problem?

japanese: 彼らは支払いを別々にした。
english: They paid separately.

japanese: 家政婦が話をさえぎった。
english: The housekeeper interrupted the conversation.

japanese: このシャツはアイロンをかける必要がある。
english: This shirt needs to be ironed.

japanese: あなたの１年間のドイツ滞在はとても有益でしたね。
english: Your year-long stay in Germany was very beneficial, wasn't it?

japanese: 別々にラッピングしてもらってもいいですか？
english: Could you wrap them up separately?

japanese: 彼はわたしに必要なものをくれた。
english: He gave me what I needed.

japanese: わたしに必要な物、それはビールだ。
english: What I need is a beer.

japanese: 「誰か警察に電話したの？」「私がしました」
english: "Has anybody called the police?" "I have."

japanese: ここに麻薬はないよ。
english: There are no drugs here.

japanese: 麻薬なんて、ここにはありません。
english: There are no drugs here.

japanese: イチゴのアイスクリーム好きなんだ。
english: I like strawberry ice cream.

japanese: ストロベリーアイスが好きだよ。
english: I like strawberry ice cream.

japanese: 台所をよろしく。
english: You do the kitchen.

japanese: 私たちは長時間待ったが、彼女は現れなかった。
english: We waited a long time, but she didn't show up.

japanese: 夜遅く家に帰ると親がガミガミうるさくて嫌になっちゃう。どんなに遅くても起きて待ってるんだよ。寝てればいいのにさ。
english: Whenever I come home late at night, my parents scold me and it annoys me. No matter how late I come back, they're awake and waiting for me. It would be so nice if they just went to sleep instead.

japanese: 夜中に突然、ドアをガチャガチャさせる音がしたのでびっくりした。
english: Suddenly in the middle of the night, I was startled by the clattering sound of a door.

japanese: 寝てるときにさ、足がガクンってなる時ない？時々それで目が覚めちゃうんだ。
english: Do you ever feel your legs twitch whilst you are sleeping? It wakes me up frequently.

japanese: 父さん台所にいる？
english: Is dad in the kitchen?

japanese: 彼女の母親は、英語を習いにアメリカへ行った。
english: Her mother went to the United States to learn English.

japanese: きれいな髪してるね。
english: Your hair is pretty.

japanese: マルクが着いたときわたしは眠っていた。
english: I was asleep when Mark arrived.

japanese: ジョーカーはオールマイティーでいいよね？
english: The Joker is the wild card, OK?

japanese: オイディプスコンプレックスというのは自分にも当てはまるのだろうか？まったくそういう気がしない。
english: Does the Oedipus Complex apply to me, too? It sure doesn't feel like it, though.

japanese: メキシコ湾で使われた大量のオイルフェンスは、リサイクルされて電気自動車のパーツになっている。
english: The many oil fences that were used in the Gulf of Mexico got recycled for parts that are now used in electric cars.

japanese: 父の日に娘からオカリナをもらった。正直言っていらない。どこからこんなチョイスを思いつくのか不思議だ。
english: I got an ocarina from my daughter on Father's Day. Frankly, though, I don't need it. I wonder where she could have come up with such a present.

japanese: 俺キーチェンジしたら音取れないんだよね。原曲のキーで行ってたまにオクターブ下げて歌うっていう方がいい。
english: If I change key, I can't hold the pitch. It's better if we go with the original key, and I sometimes sing an octave lower.

japanese: 直美は公演中にオケピに落ちて腕を折った。
english: Naomi fell in the orchestra pit during her performance and broke her arm.

japanese: 前通っていた英会話学校はオセアニア出身の教師が多かった。
english: There were a lot of Oceanian teachers at the English conversation school I went to previously.

japanese: 得意料理はオニオングラタンスープです。
english: My specialty is French onion gratin soup.

japanese: これセールで３０％オフだったんだ。
english: It was 30% off during the sale.

japanese: 社長はオフのときは携帯を持たない。
english: The CEO doesn't take his cellphone when he's not working.

japanese: オフサイド・・・じゃない！やったー！
english: An offside... No! We did it-!

japanese: 次の駅は、どこ？
english: What's the next station?

japanese: 大変遺憾に思います。
english: I regret that quite a lot.

japanese: もっと普通に曖昧な文上げろよ。
english: Let's add ambiguous sentences more often.

japanese: 生産て言うのもおこがましいな。処理くらいじゃないか。
english: It's presumptuous to say that it's "production". Isn't it more processing?

japanese: 紙をくしゃくしゃに丸めたり、びりびりに破ったりする遊びは、子供の創造力を高めます。
english: Playing, such as crumpling paper into a ball or tearing into pieces, helps develop children's creativity.

japanese: あんな男の顔なんか二度と見たくないから、あいつの写真を全部びりびりに破って燃やしてやったわ。
english: I never want to see his face again, so I tore all of his pictures into pieces and burned them.

japanese: 彼、彼女って日本語らしくないから使う度に罪悪感覚えるんだよね。
english: "He" and "she" don't sound Japanese, so I feel guilty every time I use them.

japanese: どうしよう！お父さんの会社の書類をゴミと間違えてくしゃくしゃにしちゃった！
english: What should I do! I mistook my father's company documents for trash and crumpled them!

japanese: まだ試行錯誤だな。
english: It's still being tested.

japanese: あとで添削せにゃ。
english: I'll look it over later.

japanese: くしゃっとした感じで、ふんわりとした髪型にしたいんです。
english: I want to style my hair so it's fluffy and feels snug.

japanese: 世間は厳しい。
english: The world is harsh.

japanese: 永遠に生き続ける者なし。
english: Nobody lives forever.

japanese: 「で、フランス語の試験受けたの？」「受けなかったよ。しゃべる練習めんどい」
english: "So did you take your French test?" "No. I don't feel like practicing speaking."

japanese: 楽しみ以上の有用性て何かあるのか？
english: What purpose does it have aside from for amusement?

japanese: 服は畳むかハンガーにかけておかないと、くしゃくしゃになっちゃうよ。
english: If you don't fold your clothes or hang them, they will be wrinkled.

japanese: 何度も何度も同じことを聞くな。さっきちゃんと説明しただろ。くどいぞ。
english: Don't ask the same thing over and over again. I explained it properly to you already. It's getting tedious.

japanese: この煮物、ちょっとくどいな。もっとあっさりした味付けが好みなんだけど。
english: This simmered dish has a bit of a strong taste, don't you think? It may just be that I prefer plainer foods though.

japanese: 私の料理の味付けに文句があるなら、明日からあなたが作ればいいでしょ。
english: If you don't like the way I cook, why don't you do the cooking starting tomorrow?

japanese: 手で食べるよ。
english: I eat with my hands.

japanese: 車にガソリン入ってる？
english: Is there gas inside the car?

japanese: フィギュアスケートの選手って、あんなに高速でくるくる回転してるのに、なんで目が回らずにいられるんだろう。
english: I wonder how figure-skaters are able to keep from being dizzy when they spin really fast.

japanese: 日本の首相はくるくる変わるので、歴代の首相の名前がなかなか思い出せない。
english: Japan's prime ministers change rapidly so I can't really remember each of their names.

japanese: 医者は患者を生きたまま霊安室へ送った。
english: The doctor sent the live patient to the morgue.

japanese: ご飯を食べる前には、「いただきます」を言ってから食べるのがマナーだからね。
english: It's polite to say "itadakimasu" before eating one's meal.

japanese: ご飯を食べ終わったら、「ごちそうさまでした」と言わなくちゃだめだよ。
english: After finishing eating, one must say, "Thanks for the food."

japanese: 「もうこんな時間！学校に遅れちゃう！いってきます！」「いってらっしゃい。気をつけてね」
english: "Look at the time! I'm gonna be late for school! Bye!" "See you later. Be careful."

japanese: 彼女の無責任さには呆れてしまう。
english: I'm surprised by her lack of responsibility.

japanese: アレルギーがあるのに子どもに卵を食べさせてしまった。
english: Even though she's allergic, I gave an egg to the child.

japanese: 転んで腕を折ってしまった。
english: I fell and broke my arm.

japanese: ふざけてないで早く食べてしまいなさい。
english: Don't mess around and finish your meal quickly.

japanese: 遊びに行く前に宿題をやってしまいなさい。
english: Before you go play, do your homework.

japanese: 救援作戦はオペレーション・トモダチと名付けられた。
english: The rescue operation was called "Operation Tomodachi".

japanese: だからぁ、ミュージカルじゃなくてオペレッタなの！
english: Again, it's not a musical, it's an operetta!

japanese: オラクルマスターって言うからスピリチュアル関係かと思ったらコンピューター関係じゃん。つまらん。
english: It said "Oracle Master," so I thought it was something related to spirits, but no, it was only about computers. Boring.

japanese: 「お前の彼女、類人猿で言うと何に似てる？」「何ちゅう質問だ・・・。うーん・・・オランウータンかな」
english: "What anthropoid would your girlfriend be most like?" "What a question... Well, um... An orangutan, I guess."

japanese: ぐっすりおやすみ、ティミー。
english: Sleep well, Timmy.

japanese: 地震に気付かずぐうすか寝ていられるなんて信じられない。
english: I can't believe you could sleep soundly without noticing the earthquake.

japanese: 兄を紹介します。
english: I'll introduce you to my brother.

japanese: 私の弟を紹介します。
english: I'll introduce you to my brother.

japanese: 発熱は体の防御反応の一つだ。
english: Fever is one of the body's defence mechanisms.

japanese: 子供の時、熱があるときだけはアイスクリームとかゼリーとかたくさん食べても怒られなかったなあ。
english: Only when I got sick as a kid that I could eat as much ice cream and jello as I wanted and not get yelled at.

japanese: あまりの暑さに、猫が床にぐったりと寝そべっている。
english: In the scorching heat, the cat is spread out lethargically on the ground.

japanese: そんな動物園のライオンみたいにぐたっと寝ていないで、部屋の片づけでもしたらどうなの。
english: Don't just sleep all day like some lion from the zoo. How about you go and clean up your room?

japanese: 夜中にぐらっと揺れてから、怖くてなかなか眠れなかった。
english: There was a violent tremor during the night, so I was scared and couldn't sleep very well.

japanese: 今度のハロウィンパーティーで、トイレットペーパーをグルグルに巻き付けたミイラの仮装をしようと思うんだ。
english: I think that my costume for the upcoming Halloween party will be wrapping myself up in toilet paper like a mummy.

japanese: 雨の日は髪の毛がうねうねするから、嫌。
english: My hair gets all frizzly on rainy days, so I dislike them.

japanese: 今年の夏は、自転車で北海道をぐるっと一周してきたんだ。
english: I went around Hokkaido by bike this summer.

japanese: 静まり返った部屋の中では、古い時計のコチコチいう音だけが響いていた。
english: As the room fall silent, only the ticking sound of an old clock could be heard.

japanese: コチコチに冷凍されたお肉の味を損なわずに解凍するには、低温でゆっくりが原則です。
english: In order to thaw frozen meat without marring its flavor, it is best practice to do so slowly and at a low temperature.

japanese: 禁じられた蝿の容器を触っちゃいけません。
english: Don't touch the container with the forbidden flies.

japanese: 彼は厳しく市長を講評した。
english: He severely criticized the mayor.

japanese: 豆腐は酒とよく合う。
english: Tofu goes well with good sake.

japanese: 豆腐はお酒のいいつまみになります。
english: Tofu goes well with good sake.

japanese: ここ、私が若いときに住んでた家なんだ。
english: This is the house I lived in when I was young.

japanese: 救援作戦はトモダチサクセンと名付けられた。
english: The rescue operation was called "Operation Tomodachi".

japanese: 純子は美人です。
english: Junko is a beautiful girl.

japanese: 今日からこつこつ小銭を貯めて、新しいゲームソフトを買うんだ。
english: Starting today, I'll save all my small change so I can buy some new game software.

japanese: お母さん、何か手伝うことない？何でもやるよ。
english: Mother, is there nothing I can help you with? Nothing at all?

japanese: どんな勉強でも、毎日コツコツとやるのが一番だと思う。
english: No matter what you're studying, I think it's best to study a little every day.

japanese: ハイヒールのコツコツいう音、なんか耳障りなんだよね。本人たちは何とも思わないのかな。
english: The clicking of high heels kind of hurts my ears. Do the people wearing them not notice?

japanese: 空手が趣味だとは意外だな。いつもかわいらしい服を着た女の子なのに。
english: I was surprised that her hobby was karate. She always wears cute clothes.

japanese: パパ、もう歩けないよ！ねえ、おんぶして！
english: I can't walk anymore, Dad! Carry me please!

japanese: パパ、もう歩けない。抱っこ。
english: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Carry me.

japanese: うちの子はカタカタと音のするおもちゃが大好きで、他のおもちゃには見向きもしない。
english: Our child loves toys that make a rattling noise, and doesn't take notice of anything else.

japanese: その泥棒はすばしっこく走った。
english: The thief ran quickly.

japanese: ジョーはどこへ行ったんだろう？
english: Where did Joe go?

japanese: すっかり迷ってしまった。
english: I'm so lost.

japanese: このエントリーフォームが動かないのか、それともうちのインターネット接続が正常じゃないのか？
english: Is the entry form not working or is my Internet connection not working right?

japanese: 今テストしてみたところ、若干動作が鈍いが、正常に動く。
english: I just did a test and it's a bit slow but working fine.

japanese: ブラウザは何をお使いですか？
english: Which browser are you using?

japanese: 君の死は私の生。
english: Your death is my life.

japanese: 素数はどれでしょう。
english: Which are the prime numbers?

japanese: 私の足が弱い。
english: My legs are weak.

japanese: 私の足は弱い。
english: My legs are weak.

japanese: 雑誌によってはライターに自由に書かせて後でレイアウトなんだけど、あの雑誌はデザイン優先で字数全部決まってた。
english: Magazines let writers write what they want and decide how to lay it out afterward, but that magazine prioritizes its design, so it sets a predetermined limit on how many words are in it.
